oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Monochromatic tree covers and Ramsey numbers for set-coloured graphs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bustamante, Sebastián
Stein, Maya
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We extend results on monochromatic tree covers and from classical Ramsey theory to a generalised setting, where each of the edges of an underlying host graph (here, either a complete graph or a complete bipartite graph), is coloured with a {\em set} of colours. Our results for tree covers in this setting have an application to Ryser's Conjecture. Every $r$-partite $r$-uniform hypergraph whose edges pairwise intersect in at least $k\geq (r-2)/2$ vertices, has a transversal of size at most $r-k$. In particular, for these hypergraphs, Ryser's conjecture holds.
